title: Signature
description: Follow this pattern to capture digital signatures when forms require users to certify information.

frontMatter.title: Signature
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to capture digital signatures when forms require users to certify information.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when forms require users to certify information through a statement of truth. An e-signature has the same legal weight as a handwritten signature under federal law.

when_to_use.value: **Forms requiring certification.** When users must certify the accuracy of their submission through a statement of truth.
**Legal compliance.** When forms must comply with electronic signature regulations (GPEA, UETA, ESIGN).

design_principles.value: **Do not add a privacy policy checkbox.** The signature pattern replaces the need for a separate privacy acknowledgment.
**Use Statement of truth component.** Implement the dedicated component rather than alternatives.
**Include proper timestamps.** All signatures must include UTC date and time stamps.
**Indicate authentication level.** Watermarks must reflect whether the user was unauthenticated, IAL1, or IAL2.

when_not_to_use.value: **Not all forms need this.** Only use for forms that specifically require certification or statement of truth.

examples.title: Statement of truth
examples.description: Signature section with certification statement and text input for user's name.

examples.title: PDF with signature
examples.description: Generated PDF showing signature field, date signed, and authentication watermark.

how_to_build.intro: The signature pattern captures electronic signatures that comply with federal regulations.

steps.value: Include instructions around signing the certification.
Use a card container for the signature section.
Implement the Statement of truth component.
For PDFs, include: signature field (user's name), date signed (UTC), and authentication watermark.
Watermark format varies by authentication level: unauthenticated, IAL1, or IAL2.

frontMatter.code_usage:
The signature pattern is implemented using the Statement of truth component.

**PDF Requirements:**
- Signature Field: Veteran's name from Statement of truth input
- Date Signed: Current submission date (UTC)
- Watermark: Bottom-right with authentication level and timestamp
- VA DATE STAMP Box: Fill when form includes it (upper right corner)

**Watermark formats by authentication level:**
- Unauthenticated: "Signed electronically at [HH:MM] UTC [YYYY-MM-DD]. Signee not signed in."
- IAL1: "...hasn't verified their identity."
- IAL2: "...signed with an identity-verified account."

content_considerations.value: Use UTC timezone for all date/time stamps.
Timestamps should reflect initial submission date, not PDF generation date.
For signed-in users, use their authenticated name for the signature field.

accessibility.value: Ensure the signature input field has a clear, visible label.
The statement of truth must be readable by screen readers.
Provide clear instructions about what the user is certifying.
